questions.text: In MI, which of the following markers is most likely to be increased in the first few minutes after the onset of CP and back to baseline within 12 hours?

A 60-year-old woman with CAD and HTN is in the ICU recovering from a partial colectomy. On POD3 she is developed confusion. Her temperature is 37°C (98.4°F), BP is 88/60 mm Hg, PR is 118/min/regular, and RR is 28/min. Her PCWP is 20 mm Hg. Her ECG is unchanged, and cardiac enzyme levels are normal. What is the most likely cause of this patient's shock?

A 72-year-old woman was admitted with AECOPD. After initial treatment with salbutamol and CS, her RR has normalized, and her SpO2 is now 88%–92% but PR is still 110/min. She no longer reports dyspnea or cough. Which of the following is most likely to be seen in this patient?
A patient with Ebstein’s anomaly presented with arrhythmia. What is the long-term management?

A 48-year-old man with DM2 and HTN presents for an annual check-up. His current medications are MF and telmisartan. His temperature is 37.2°C (98.7°F), HR is 82/min, BP is 146/84 mm Hg, and 6. RR is 18/min. Laboratory tests show: HbA1C: 7.5%, TC: 225 mg/dL, LDL-C: 165 mg/dL, HDL-C 30 mg/dL, TG: 150 mg/dL. Which of the following targets is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Target LDL cholesterol < 100 mg/dL and BP <130/80 mm Hg

options.label: B
options.text: Target LDL cholesterol < 70 mg/dL and BP <130/80 mm Hg

options.label: C
options.text: Target LDL cholesterol < 100 mg/dL and A1C < 9%

options.label: D
options.text: Target total cholesterol < 70 mg/dL and hemoglobin A1c < 8%

questions.correct_answer: A. Target LDL cholesterol < 100 mg/dL and BP <130/80 mm Hg
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Target LDL cholesterol < 100 mg/dL and BP <130/80 mm Hg

questions.text: 54-year-old man comes to the clinic because of intermittent CP. He describes the pain as vague sense of nausea and chest tightness. The episodes last 1-2 minutes occur randomly. He does not exercise and has a significant smoking history. He is moderately obese and is in no apparent distress. His BP is 152/88 mm Hg. Her ECG, lytes and biomarkers are normal. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in diagnosis?

A 25-year-old presents to his physician because of increasing SOB, palpitations, and CP with exertion over the past 2 months. Cardiac examination reveals a widely split S2 that narrows with inspiration, and a systolic crescendo-decrescendo murmur best heard at the LLSB. Which of the following would most likely lead to a decrease in the intensity of the murmur?

A 72-year-old man with a history of HTN, DM2, and DLP is brought to the ER because of reports of palpitations and dizziness. ECG is ordered and shown in the image. His temperature is 36.8°C, PR is 106/min, RR is 18/min, BPis 84/46 mm Hg, and SpO2 is 92% on room air. What is the next step?

A 52-year-old man presents for a MHC. His BP is 148/96 mm Hg and has LUTS. The exam is normal except for an enlarged, smooth prostate. Laboratory studies done were normal. What is the most appropriate next step in management?

A 74-year-old man with a history of DLP, HTN and aortic sclerosis presents to the ER with CP. The CP is like angina attacks in his past. He took 3 NTG tablets with some relief. In the ER he is given ASA, metoprolol, and morphine and is placed on nasal O2 & ECG monitoring. On exam the patient is diaphoretic and appears to be uncomfortable. His vitals are stable and cardiac enzymes were normal. An ECG on admission is shown. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 72-year-old man presented 2 days ago to the ER with chest pain and was diagnosed/treated for Anterior MI. On the morning of his second hospital day, his PR is 60/min, RR is 16/min, BP is 124/76 mm Hg, temperature is 36.7°C (98°F), and SpO2 is 99% on room air. A routine ECG is obtained and shown. What is the most appropriate Rx?
A patient collapsed and was brought to the casualty with no proper history. What is the next step?
Which of the following is the strongest predictor of cardiovascular disease incidence and subsequent mortality due to CVD?

A 51-year-old male presents recurrent CP 4 days after a STEMI. The CP radiates to the trapezius and worse with deep inspiration. The pain woke him from sleep and has improved slightly after getting up out of bed. His CTn levels were unchanged, and ECG was showed new ST elevations in inferior and lateral leads. What is the likely cause?
A 60-year-old man post MI had the following lab values LDL -127mg/dl, HDL -32 mg/dl, TGL -270mg/dl. Which of the following must be his treatment plan?

A 70-year-old man presented with CP and was noted to have 2 mm of ST segment elevation in his inferior leads. He has a SBP of 84 mm Hg and a HR at 124 beats/min. On examination, he seems less alert, his JVP is elevated, and his lungs are clear. Which of the following is the best treatment?

A 68-year-old gentleman is brought into your ER after a syncope. The monitor showed a HR of 190 bpm with a BP of 85/50mmHg. His SpO2 is 98% (on NRBM). ECG shows a regular WCT with no apparent P waves. Regarding the JVP waveform, which of these features would you expect to see?

Which of the following fits into the picture of Papillary muscle rupture, Cardiac tamponade, VSD and RV infarction in order? RA = 21 mm Hg, RV = 60/22 mm Hg, PCWP = 20 mm Hg, CI = 1.7 L/min/m2, Pu.aO2 sat = 70% RA = 12 mm Hg, RV = 60/30 mm Hg, PCWP = 10 mm Hg, CI = 1.7 L/min/m2, Pu.aO2 sat = 95% RA = 15 mm Hg, RV = 60/30 mm Hg, PCWP = 6 mm Hg, CI = 1.7 L/min/m2, Pu.aO2 sat = 70% RA = 12 mm Hg, RV = 50/20 mm Hg, PCWP = 40 mm Hg, CI = 1.6 L/min/m2, Pu.aO2 sat = 75%
Which among the following according to the latest guidelines is NOT an indication to IE prophylaxis?

A 68-year-old man with a past medical history of coronary artery disease develops a myocardial infarction. He got treated in CCU and before he is discharged, he undergoes echocardiography, which reveals a left ventricular ejection fraction of 35% to 40%. He is asymptomatic. Repeat Echo after 3 months shows the same findings. What is this patient’s heart failure stage?
Which of the following medications may induce an episode of atrial fibrillation?

A 36-year-old male with a history of Brugada syndrome presents for new patient evaluation. He reports having had 2 prior episodes of syncope last summer, once while playing basketball and once after swimming. He has no history of cardiac arrest. He is adopted and does not know his biological family history. An ECG in the office shows a right bundle branch block pattern with 2 mm coved ST-segment elevations in the anterior precordial leads. Which of the following treatments would reduce this patient’s risk of sudden cardiac death (SCD)?
A 33-year-old female presents to her physician with complaints of palpitations. An ECG is taken during an episode and provided below. She is otherwise stable. What is the next step?

A 66-year-old woman comes to the ER complaining of fatigue 2 days and an episode of hemoptysis. She has a H/o AF and OA – on naproxen and warfarin. Her BP is 60/40 mm Hg and labs showed – INR 5.1 and Hct 12.6%. She received IV vitamin K, 4 U PRBCs and 4U FFP. 8h later, she begins to complain of SOB. Vitals T - 39°C, RR 35/min, SpO2 84% on RA, and BP 100/52 mm Hg. Exam revealed B/L crackles and the patient was intubated for respiratory failure. CXR is shown. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 19-year-old presented with C/o tender, painful skin lesions in his axilla. He reports multiple similar episodes in the past. Current report – positive cultures for Serratia marcescens. All the following statements are true EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Infections with coagulase positive organisms are typical

options.label: B
options.text: Prophylactic use of TMP/SMX is effective

questions.correct_answer: A. Infections with coagulase positive organisms are typical
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Infections with coagulase positive organisms are typical.

questions.text: What is the expected MCV in CBC based on the PS image?
All are incorrect regarding CUP except:

options.label: C
options.text: Most common genomic alteration is KRAS mutation.

options.label: D
options.text: CK7 -/CK20 – is the typical profile of CRCs.

questions.text: Which of the following is characteristic of tumor suppressor genes?

options.label: A
options.text: The mutant allele is often inherited through the germ line

options.label: B
options.text: The somatic mutation does not contribute to cancer

options.label: C
options.text: The inherited form of the mutant allele does not commonly have a tissue preference

options.label: D
options.text: The mutant allele acts in a dominant fashion

questions.correct_answer: A. The mutant allele is often inherited through the germ line
questions.explanation: Ans. A. The mutant allele is often inherited through the germ line

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a hallmark of cancer?

options.label: A
options.text: Immune evasion & avoiding immune mediated destruction

questions.text: A 23-year-old man with HL was treated successfully with the ABVD regimen Which of the following drugs used in the Rx of this patient is cell cycle specific?
A patient was about to receive cisplatin for chemotherapy. What are the drugs that can be offered to prevent/reduce chemotherapy induced nausea and vomiting?
All the following would be important for prevention of the CTLS EXCEPT:

options.label: B
options.text: Administration of IV fluids at a minimum of 3000 mL/m2 daily

options.label: C
options.text: Alkalinization of the urine by administration of NaHCO3

options.label: D
options.text: Frequent monitoring of serum chemistries every 4 hours

questions.correct_answer: C. Alkalinization of the urine by administration of NaHCO3
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Alkalinization of the urine by administration of NaHCO3

questions.text: CSI is primarily used in?
Which of the following is most likely to be the major underlying cause of the anemia in a patient with chronic HFrEF?

options.label: A
options.text: ↑ RBC destruction 2° to deposition of complement on the RBC membrane

options.label: C
options.text: ↓ Life of RBCs because of maladaptive changes to the RBC membrane

options.label: D
options.text: ↓ Intestinal absorption of Fe secondary to ↑ circulating hepcidin levels

questions.correct_answer: D. ↓ Intestinal absorption of Fe secondary to ↑ circulating hepcidin levels
questions.explanation: Ans. D. ↓ Intestinal absorption of Fe secondary to ↑ circulating hepcidin levels

questions.text: A 39-year-old male presents with vague abdominal pain and ED to the emergency department (ED). He also complains of fatigue and light pink urine. Labs - Hb 8.1 g/dl, ↑ retics, ↓ haptoglobin, ↑ LDH and bilirubin. The loss of which cell surface proteins during FCx would most likely be responsible for the hemoglobinuria in this patient?

A 65-year-old was admitted for a infected wound for which he received vancomycin. He developed several bruises on his arms and legs with no obvious signs of trauma. His PT/PTT are within normal limits, HBV/HCV are negative, WBC 6.5 x 103 uL, HGB, 14.2 g/dL, and platelets 18,000/uL. In previous laboratory examinations, all laboratory levels were found to be within normal limits. Based on the patient's clinic presentation which of the following is the most likely explanation of the patient's findings?

A 32-year-old woman presents two years after Rx and remission of cHL with painful right cervical lymphadenopathy. A FDG-PET scan shows hypermetabolic lesions in the right infraclavicular, B/L hilar, para-aortic, and inguinal lymph nodes. What regimen would be frontline therapy for this recurrent disease?

A 67-year-old woman presents with painless cervical LAN. Her WBC count is 5000 cells/µL, ANC 2500/µL, ALC 1900/µL, platelets 220,000/µL and Hb is 13.9 g/dL. She has B/L cervical, axillary, and inguinal LAN. BMAx demonstrates normal trilineage hematopoiesis. Fcx of axillary LN Bx showed a population of neoplastic lymphoid cells is identified which is positive for CD5, CD19, CD20 (dim), and CD23, and negative for CD10 and CD38. CCND1 stain by IHC is negative. There are no cytogenetic abnormalities identified. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is usually the first to be affected in a disoriented patient?
All the following statements regarding astrocytes are true EXCEPT:

options.label: B
options.text: They exert effects on the life of synapses

options.label: C
options.text: They make up ≥ 90% of all CNS cells

options.label: D
options.text: They participate in the dynamic regulation of local vascular tone

questions.correct_answer: C. They make up ≥ 90% of all CNS cells
questions.explanation: Ans. C. They make up ≥ 90% of all CNS cells

questions.text: Which of the following factors is of greatest concern regarding the risk of recurrent Sz?
questions.correct_answer: A. Focal defect on neurologic examination
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Focal defect on neurologic examination

questions.text: A 38-year-old man with a H/o Sz disorder presents with GCSE. He had been having persistent Sz activity for 20 minutes when EMS was activated. He was given lorazepam 8 mg IV and on arrival in the ER 20 minutes later, he threw another Sz. Vitals - temperature is 39.2°C (102.5°F), BP 182/92, HR 158 beats/min, RR 38 breaths/min, and SpO2 95%. Which of the following is the next step in the management of this patient?

A 46-year-old male presents to the ER with the acute onset of ataxia. Neurological examination shows loss of pain and temperature sensation from the face on the left side and loss of pain and temperature sensation from the right half of the body. He also has dysarthria, dysphagia, and diminished gag reflex with ptosis, miosis, and anhidrosis on the left. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old F1 driver complains of neck pain following a race. 3 days later he presents with left sided facial numbness as well as numbness across the right upper and lower limb. On exam - the left pupil is much smaller than the right and there is a partial ptosis on the left. Eye movements are normal. Power, coordination, and reflexes are all normal. What is the gold standard brain-imaging method used in order to establish the primary diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. CT angiogram of head & neck
questions.explanation: Ans. D. CT angiogram of head & neck

questions.text: This patient was presented with diplopia. Identify the injured nerve based on the test given in the picture:
A patient comes to ER with headache describing it as worst headache in his life. Initial NCCT is shows SAH. What is the next step?
An 80-year-old man is investigated for progressive cognitive impairment. Which one of the following features is most suggestive of Lewy body dementia?

A 44-year-old male presents to your clinic with a 6-month history of left-sided daily headaches located in the frontal and retro-orbital area. He denies any pain-free periods. The headaches are of moderate 5/10 severity with unpredictable exacerbations of severe pain going up to 9/10 severity. He describes to you what sounds to you like left-sided conjunctival injection and lacrimation often occurring alongside the headaches. Which of the following is most likely to aid you in making a diagnosis?
A 60-year-old woman presents with a tremor. Which one of the following features would suggest a diagnosis of essential tremor rather than Parkinson's disease?

options.label: D
options.text: Tremor is worse when the arms are outstretched

questions.correct_answer: D. Tremor is worse when the arms are outstretched
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Tremor is worse when the arms are outstretched

questions.text: This is the MRI of a patient who had a history of multiple falls. Identify the sign that is not associated with the diagnosis:
In wernikes encephalopathy, the earliest clinical feature to recover is?
PNS characterized by anti YO antibodies are characterised by –

A patient came with complaints of high-grade fever and altered sensorium. He was diagnosed to be suffering from meningococcal meningitis. Which of the following is the most appropriate empirical treatment option?

A 30-year-old female presents to her physician with blurred vision in the left eye which developed gradually over the past week. Past medical history is significant for an episode of left face, arm, and leg weakness with imbalance lasting two weeks, which occurred three years ago. Eye examination revealed swelling of the optic disk & decreased pupillary constriction to light. What is the likely diagnosis?
The Miller-Fisher variant of GBS presents as a triad of which symptoms?
Which of the following is not a risk factor for peptic ulcer disease?
Which of the following regarding non-invasive testing for H. pylori is true?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no reliable non-invasive method to detect H. pylori

options.label: B
options.text: False negative UBT reports occur with use of NSAIDs

options.label: C
options.text: Serology offer the greatest sensitivity for diagnosis of infection

options.label: D
options.text: Exposure to low-dose radiation is a limitation to UBT

questions.correct_answer: D. Exposure to low-dose radiation is a limitation to UBT
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Exposure to low-dose radiation is a limitation to UBT

questions.text: All the following are treatment options for IBS – D except?

A 59-year-old female develops acute diverticulitis and hospitalized for IV antibiotics. Her CT scan does not show evidence of abscess perforation, stricture, or fistula, and she improves in about a week. Which of the following should be advised at discharge?
questions.correct_answer: B. Initiation of a high-fiber diet
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Initiation of a high-fiber diet

questions.text: A 54-year-old man presents with 1 month of diarrhea. He states that he has 8 to 10 loose bowel movements a day. He has lost 6 kgs during this time. Vital signs and physical examination are normal. Serum lab studies are normal. A 24-hour stool collection reveals 500g of stool with a measured stool osmolality of 200 mOsm/Land a calculated stool osmolality of 210 mOsm/L. Based on these findings, which of the following is the most likely cause of his diarrhea?
A patient with a 5-year history of UC presents with acute abdominal pain. Workup reveals fever and leukocytosis. Plain film is shown below. What is the next management?

A 74-year-old woman underwent a hip surgery and on POD2 she complains of increasing abdominal discomfort and distension. On physical examination, she is afebrile with a BP 140/80, HR 110 bpm, RR 16 and SpO2 100% on 2 L O2. She has a distended tympanic abdomen with absent bowel sounds. There is no rebound tenderness. Xray is shown. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
You are reviewing a serology report of a patient in a routine MHC – HBSAg: Negative Anti HBS: Negative Anti HBC: Positive HBEAg: Negative Anti HBE: Negative. All of the following are true except.
Which of the following is incorrect with regards to DILI?

options.label: A
options.text: Direct toxic hepatitis is usually clinically indistinguishable from viral hepatitis

options.label: B
options.text: Idiosyncratic reactions are unpredictable and is NOT dose dependent

options.label: C
options.text: The occurrence of jaundice in a phase 3 clinical trial is predictive of severe hepatotoxicity in post-marketing surveillance

options.label: D
options.text: The incidence of DILI is the same in patients with CLD

questions.correct_answer: A. Direct toxic hepatitis is usually clinically indistinguishable from viral hepatitis
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Direct toxic hepatitis is usually clinically indistinguishable from viral hepatitis

questions.text: A 34-year-old woman is evaluated for fatigue, malaise, arthralgias, and a 10-lb weight loss over the past 6–8 weeks. She has no PMH. On exam, vitals are stable and she has hepatomegaly, jaundice and mild joint swelling. Labs – AST 542 IU/L, ALT is 657 IU/L, ALP 102 IU/L, TB 5.3 mg/dL, DB is 4.8 mg/dL. Which of the following tests would be LEAST likely to be positive in this diagnosis?
All the following statements are true regarding NAFLD Rx EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Bariatric surgery is safe in patients with NAFLD

options.label: B
options.text: Vitamin E is helpful in reducing steatosis

options.label: C
options.text: Statins may worsen inflammation in NAFLD

options.label: D
options.text: There are no therapies approved by FDA for NAFLD

questions.correct_answer: C. Statins may worsen inflammation in NAFLD
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Statins may worsen inflammation in NAFLD

questions.text: A 40-year-old cirrhotic presents with increasing confusion and increasing ascites. Diagnostic paracentesis is performed that yields reveal clear fluid with 800 WBCs/ μ L (40% PMNs). Which of the following is the most indicated?
A 42-year-old man with HBV related cirrhosis has ascites requiring frequent LVP. All of the following are true regarding treatment of ascites EXCEPT:

options.label: D
options.text: TIPS has no survival benefit compared to LVP

questions.text: A 40-year-old alcoholic with ascites and jaundice presents with acute UGI bleed. All the following are appropriate treatment options EXCEPT:
Management of HRS includes all except –
Indications for cholecystectomy in gallstone disease are all except -

A 46-year-old woman presents with a 1-week history of RUQ pain, intermittent fever, and nausea. Labs – elevated TB, ALP and mild transaminitis. USG – normal. MRCP reveals a beaded appearance of her intrahepatic and extrahepatic bile ducts due to multiple discrete strictures. Which of the following lab tests would be most helpful?
Which of the following regarding pancreatic enzyme secretion is incorrect?

options.label: B
options.text: All pancreatic enzymes are secreted as zymogens

options.label: C
options.text: CCK receptors are NOT seen on acinar cells

options.label: D
options.text: Enterokinase found in the duodenal mucosa activates trypsinogen

questions.correct_answer: A. Ach inhibits pancreatic enzyme secretion
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Ach inhibits pancreatic enzyme secretion

questions.text: All are accepted diagnostic criteria for acute pancreatitis EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Confirmatory findings of acute pancreatitis on cross-sectional imaging

options.label: C
options.text: ≥ 3x elevation in serum lipase and/or amylase

options.label: D
options.text: Typical abdominal pain in the epigastrium that may radiate to the back

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman with CF is diagnosed with chronic pancreatitis. All of the following complications may be seen EXCEPT:
